HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : The patient is a 53 year old woman who presents to Ymam Center after a mechanical fall onto her left hip while doing laundry . The patient reports that she twisted and lost her balance causing a fall directly onto her hip . She did not hit her head . There was no loss of consciousness . She currently complains of left hip pain and groin pain without any other complaints . She has no numbness , tingling , or weakness in her legs . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : Hypertension . PAST SURGICAL HISTORY : None . ALLERGIES : Nifedipine causes headaches . MEDICATIONS : Atenolol 50 mg p.o. q.d. , Zestril 10 mg p.o. q.d. , and aspirin 325 mg p.o. q.d. PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : VITAL SIGNS : She is afebrile . Her vital signs are stable . She is alert and oriented . HEART : Regular rate and rhythm . LUNGS : Clear to auscultation bilaterally . Pelvis is stable to AP and lateral compression . EXTREMITIES : Her bilateral upper extremities are nontender with sensation and motor intact . Her right lower extremity is nontender with full range of motion . Her left lower extremity is shortened by 1 cm . She has swelling and tenderness of her greater trochanter area . She has sensation to light touch which is intact . She has bilateral palpable dorsalis pedis pulse and posterior tibial pulse . Her strength is 5/5 bilaterally . LABORATORY DATA : The x-ray is significant for posteriorly displaced and complete subcapital femoral neck fracture . HOSPITAL COURSE : The patient was admitted to Ymam Center on 4/23/01 . The patient was preopped for surgical repair of her hip fracture . On 4/24/01 the patient went to the operating room for left hip open reduction and internal fixation which she tolerated well without complications . Perioperatively she was kept on antibiotics for emperic therapy . She was started on Coumadin anticoagulation with a goal INR of 1.5 to 2.0 . She was made touch down weight bearing on her left lower extremity and physical therapy was consulted to assist with activity . Her diet was advanced as tolerated . Her IV was hep-locked on postoperative day # 1 . On the evening of postoperative day # 1 the patient spiked a fever to 102.2 thought secondary to atelectasis . She had no further temperature spikes throughout her hospital stay . She tolerated a regular diet , ambulated with physical therapy , and voided without difficulty . The patient was accepted to a rehabilitation facility and , on postoperative day # 4 , she was discharged from Ymam Center and transferred for further physical therapy in rehabilitation . DISPOSITION : The patient is to continue physical therapy with touch down weight bearing as tolerated . Please apply a dry sterile dressing to her left leg incision q.d. Titrate her dose of Coumadin for a goal INR of 1.5 to 2.0. Please call the results of the PT / INR to ( 344 ) 661-0162 at the Coumadin clinic . Call Ymam Center if the patient experiences fevers or chills , redness or discharge from her surgical site . FOLLOWUP : The patient is to follow-up with Dr. Area in the orthopedic clinic in two weeks .
